questions.question: What is the largest planet in our solar system?

answers.answer: Jupiter is the largest planet in our solar system, with a diameter of approximately 142,984 kilometers.
The largest planet in our solar system is Jupiter, which is more than 1,300 times the size of Earth.
A black hole is a region in space where the gravitational pull is so strong that nothing, including light, can escape.
A black hole is a massive, invisible object in space that is formed when a massive star collapses in on itself.

questions.question: What is the farthest human-made object from Earth?

answers.answer: The farthest human-made object from Earth is the Voyager 1 spacecraft, which is over 14 billion miles away.
The Voyager 1 spacecraft is the most distant human-made object from Earth, with a distance of over 14 billion miles.
A supernova is a massive star explosion that can be seen from millions of light-years away.
A supernova is a catastrophic event that occurs when a massive star runs out of fuel and collapses in on itself.

questions.question: What is the International Space Station?

answers.answer: The International Space Station is a habitable artificial satellite in low Earth orbit where astronauts and cosmonauts live and work.
The International Space Station is a research laboratory in space where scientists conduct experiments in microgravity.
A galaxy is a massive, gravitationally bound system of stars, stellar remnants, interstellar gas, dust, and dark matter.
A galaxy is a collection of stars, gas, and dust that are held together by gravity.
The solar system is a collection of celestial objects that orbit around the Sun, including planets, dwarf planets, asteroids, comets, and other objects.
The solar system is a group of planets and other objects that orbit around the Sun.
A comet is a small, icy body that orbits the Sun and is composed of frozen gases and dust.
A comet is a celestial object that is composed of ice and dust and orbits the Sun.
A nebula is a cloud of gas and dust in space that is the birthplace of stars.
A nebula is a massive cloud of gas and dust that is formed when a star is born or dies.
A star is a massive, luminous ball of gas that is held together by its own gravity and generates energy through nuclear reactions.
A star is a celestial object that is composed of hot, glowing gas and is the source of light and heat for planets.
